intro: Venidium subacaule, commonly known as the slender venidium, is a herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Venidium subacaule is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
